body.name: Arteck 2.4G Wireless Keyboard Stainless Steel Ultra Slim Full Size Keyboard with Numeric Keypad for Computer/Desktop/PC/Laptop/Surface/Smart TV and Windows 10/8/ 7 Built in Rechargeable Battery
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 17 hrs 59 mins
features: Easy Setup: Simply insert the nano USB receiver into your computer and use the keyboard instantly.
Ergonomic design: Metal panel material gives heavy duty feeling, low-profile keys offer quiet and comfortable typing.
6-Month Battery Life: Rechargeable lithium battery with an industry-high capacity lasts for 6 months with single charge (based on 2 hours non-stop use per day).
Ultra Thin and Light: Compact size (17.3 X 5 X 0.2in) and light weight (18.7oz) but provides full size keys, arrow keys, number pad, shortcuts for comfortable typing.
Package contents: Arteck Metal Panel 2.4G Wireless Keyboard, nano USB receiver, USB charging cable, welcome guide, our 24-month warranty and friendly customer service.
body.description: Industry Leading Ergonomic Design Stainless steel material gives heavy duty feeling and the low-profile keys offer quite and comfortable typing. Easy Setup and UseJust simply insert the nano USB receiver into your computer like desktop or laptop, then the keyboard can be used instantly. No need driver.The Keyboard will work up to 33 feet or 10 meters.It allow you to gain quick access to common functions, such as volume level, playback control, copy paste text, and more. It also provides arrow keys, number pad with slim and compact design. Comfortable, quiet typing The whisper-quiet, low-profile keys bring a whole new level of comfort to your fingertips. What's more, keep all your most-used functions and media controls closer than ever Windows-dedicated hot keys.The construction of this scissors-kick keys can be used more than 3 million times continuously. Rechargeable Battery Built-in industry-high rechargeable Li-polymer battery provides 6-month use on a single charge. (based on 2 hours non-stop use per day)

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 272 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bargain keyboard. Great battery life.
reviews.reviewText: One of my office user's Logitech keyboards was dying and the newer version of them from Logitech had horrible reviews about reliability. The local car dealer had these at every workstation and was swearing by them.Construction is very good, lightweight yet solid and not too lightweight to be sliding all around the desk. Feels much more solid than the Logitech wireless keyboards I've used over the years. Key response is more tactile than the Logitech, but nowhere near as tactile as a mechanical keyboard. I'm a keyboard snob who owns multiple IBM Model M keyboards, along with quite a few other mechanical keyboards. This keyboard is not those by any stretch of the imagination. BUT, it's quiet when typing and is a major upgrade from any built-in laptop keyboard.They claim it has a 6 month battery life at 2 hours a day. I think they're being modest. I bought this keyboard back in October and don't remember if we charged it fully or just took it out of the box. I just got a call from the user that her keyboard stopped working today (mid-April). That would be 6 months at 6-8 hours a day.I still prefer my mechanical keyboards, but I'd gladly use this over a laptop's built-in keyboard. And for the price you can do a lot worse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This keyboard is very compact. The battery last for a ling time. exactly what I need for my work office.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Since there are apparently no images of the bottom of this thing on the internet, here's one.This is a good keyboard and probably the best scissor in its price range. The keys are durable and are the exact right height. There's no wobble to them. They seem durable; you can hammer on them. Very many scissors in this price range are frankly unusable, so this is significant. I've previously returned a Perixxx, Macally, and Dell scissor keyboard at the same price. I also returned 3 mechanicals before this, all _far_ more expensive than this. They're just not an option for typing, I've decided.It has a design flaw: the F keys are the same size and shape as the rest of the keys, and are directly above the number keys. Because of this, your fingers can't feel where the number key row is, and I end up looking down a lot. Almost all keyboards have a space above the number keys, or F keys that are a different shaped, or are spaced differently, so your fingers can feel that they are at the top of the number keys. Most people subconsciously use the number keys as a guide for their fingers, and you don't notice until that guide is removed.I actually put stickers on the F keys so that I can feel them with my fingers. That helped a lot.I don't love that the keys are rounded, but I'm getting used to it. I have another Arteck scissor (they don't have model numbers; not sure how to refer to them!) with square keys, and I prefer those in general. That one is another good scissor keyboard; I am currently using it for my laptop which has a broken keyboard. It's so slim, it sits right on top.The key rounding is not too extreme, so the empty space it creates between keys is only at the corners, which I can live with. Any more and I wouldn't be able to, and I would still prefer that they were rounded just a hair less.The indentations in the keys are very shallow. They look deep in pictures, but in person they are so shallow that you can hardly see them or feel them. This is not a criticism-- the effect is very subtle and I like it, it's just not as extreme as pictures lead you to believe.The power light has an odd behavior (and different than my other 2 Artecks): when you turn the power on, the light turns on for a couple seconds, then turns off. I don't mind this, in fact I prefer it: I don't need a light on all the time that's not telling me anything I don't know. It also has a "battery low" light, so when the power IS low, you'll know why, removing the one need for a power light. So it's not a criticism, but is unexpected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this keyboard Dec 2021 when I was looking for a quieter keystroke. This keyboard is very quiet, lightweight, and portable. The keys aren't sticky and press smoothly. The most appreciated feature here is the battery life. I fully charged it upon delivery in Dec 2021 and did not charge again until April 2023. I work a part-time job, 5 days a week, and I am amazed at the battery life. I have had zero issues with this keyboard and highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great all around. Has a nice click when typing.
reviews.reviewText: No backlight but the keys are very visible, stark white letters.I spend a lot of time writing emails for work and it is nice to use this keyboard.I like the sound of the clicks using it- not clicky sounding.I actual have a different version at home with back light and I like both equally.Good brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It suits my need very well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product, outstanding functionality.
reviews.reviewText: Product is fresh out of the box, so I can't comment on battery life or durability, but there's a two year warranty, so I'm not worried in the slightest.The keyboard looks great. It has a reassuring heft in my hands, which lends to the impression of sturdiness and functionality. The keys all press very well, and register cleanly.Finally, and most importantly, I bought this gambling that it would work on the same receiver as my Arteck mouse. The bet paid off! Both can function with a single input: a huge bonus, as many modern laptops only have one, (if any) USB port.For ~20 dollars, it's worth every penny.
